intro: Micromeles cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved holly. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a slow growth rate and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
